import React, { Component } from 'react'; import './App.css'; import {Header, Grid, Button, Segment, Checkbox, Modal} from 'semantic-ui-react' import 'semantic-ui-css/semantic.min.css' import { LineChart, Line, XAxis, YAxis, CartesianGrid, Tooltip, Legend, } from 'recharts'; const op_map = {"PLUS": "+", "SUBTRACT": "-", "MULTIPLY": "*", "DIVIDE": "/"} export default class App extends Component { constructor(props){ super(props); this.state = { mode: false, curr: "0", op: "", prev: "", line_points: [{x: 0, y: 1},{x: 1, y: 1},{x: 2, y: 1},{x: 3, y: 1},{x: 4, y: 1}, {x: 5, y: 1},{x: 6, y: 1},{x: 7, y: 1},{x: 8, y: 1},{x: 9, y: 1}, {x: 10, y: 1},{x: 11, y: 1},{x: 12, y: 1},{x: 13, y: 1},{x: 14, y: 1}, {x: 15, y: 1},{x: 16, y: 1},{x: 17, y: 1},{x: 18, y: 1},{x: 19, y: 1}] } } handleToggle = () => { this.setState({ mode: !this.state.mode }) } handleSimpleOp = (o) => { const {curr, prev} = this.state prev === "" ? this.setState({ prev: curr, curr: "", op: o }) : this.setState({ op: o}) } handleComplexCompute = async (o) => { const {curr} = this.state const rawResponse = await fetch("http://localhost:8080/calc?exp=_" + o + '!' + curr) const json = await rawResponse.json() this.setState({ curr: json.result }) } handleSimpleCompute = async () =>{ const {curr, prev, op} = this.state; const rawResponse = await fetch("http://localhost:8080/calc?exp=" + prev + '!' + op + "$" + curr) const json = await rawResponse.json() this.setState({ curr: json.result, prev: "", op: "" }) } handleNumber = (n) => { const {curr} = this.state; if (curr !== "0"){ this.setState({ curr: curr + n }) } else { this.setState({ curr: n }) } } render() { const {curr, prev, op, mode, line_points} = this.state return (
{prev !== "" ? prev + " " + op_map[op] + " " + curr : curr}
{ !mode && } {mode && prev !== "" &&
Darn! You can't access complex functions when working on an expression.

}
) } }
